relationships.notes: Voices loyalty about dying with Jesus, questions his destination, and finally confesses him as Lord and God when the risen Jesus meets his conditions for belief.
Remains in prayer with Peter and the other apostles in Jerusalem after the ascension, sharing responsibility for the community's leadership.

traits.role_among_twelve: Listed among the Twelve appointed by Jesus, without individual actions or dialogue.
traits.narrative_profile: Remains a name in the apostolic list with no distinctive characterization or story.
traits.function_in_gospel: Serves to round out the formal roster of authorized followers commissioned by Jesus.

traits.role_among_twelve: Named among the Twelve whom Jesus authorizes and sends out with exorcistic and healing authority.
traits.narrative_profile: Receives no speeches or separate scenes; his identity is confined to the apostolic catalog.
traits.function_in_gospel: Embodies one of the commissioned insiders whose presence undergirds the authority and mission of the Matthean community.

traits.role_among_twelve: Appears in the list of the Twelve whom Jesus designates 'apostles'.
traits.narrative_profile: Like several others in the list, he is not given any individual dialogue or story.
traits.function_in_gospel: Represents one of the foundational witnesses around whom the early Jesus movement is structured.

traits.role_among_disciples: One of the Twelve whose questions and responses frame major Christological discourses.
traits.nickname_and_identity: Repeatedly identified as 'Thomas, called Didymus (Twin)', giving him a distinctive epithet within the group.
traits.loyalty_and_courage: Proposes that the disciples go to Judea to die with Jesus, showing grim loyalty in the face of danger.
traits.misunderstanding_and_questions: Voices confusion about Jesus' destination and the 'way', prompting Jesus' self-revelation as the way, truth, and life.
traits.resurrection_reaction: Initially refuses to accept the others' resurrection testimony without physical proof, then responds to the risen Jesus with the climactic confession 'My Lord and my God'.
traits.theological_function: Personifies both skeptical refusal and ultimate, high Christological confession, modeling a move from doubt to belief in Jesus' exalted status.

traits.post_easter_status: Named among the apostles gathered in Jerusalem after Jesus' ascension.
traits.community_role: Counts as one of the core witnesses and leaders who devote themselves to prayer while awaiting the Spirit.
traits.narrative_profile: Does not speak or act individually; his significance is as a member of the Jerusalem apostolic circle.
